entry.title: Setting up AI-assisted production routing proposals using SAP S/4HANA ISLM
entry.content:
In today’s blog, I will walk you through the setup of the AI-assisted production routing proposal feature using S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM). If you are not familiar with S/4HANA Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM), I recommend you get a first idea by looking at our Product Help. 

Why AI-Assisted Production Routing Proposals?

This AI feature can help production engineers, production planners, or master data specialists create new production routings more efficiently: In the Manager Routings app, they can use AI to get recommendations of routings that they can copy or reuse, based on BOM similarity.

The scenario is based on the K-nearest neighbors (KNN) algorithm. The intelligent scenario provides three BOMs that are considered most similar to the material and BOM that the user specified to find routings for copying. The system proposes existing production routings that could be used to copy based on the applicability of the production version where that routing and the similar BOM that is predicted by the model are used together. 

The routings that are associated with these similar materials and their BOMs are proposed based on certain factors related to the BOM and the production versions in which these BOMs are used. Proposals are listed based on priority of the following factors:

  1. Validity date of a similar alternative BOM matching the production version that uses the proposed routing.
  2. Lot size of a similar alternative BOM matching the production version that uses the proposed routing.
  3. Production version having the maximum number of production orders.

Users can select a match to display and verify the related routings. They can then choose the most suitable routing from the proposed list, copy it and use it as a template for their new routing.

During this process, the AI feature helps to minimize the time spent on repetitive data entry and reduces the risk of errors. If you want to find out more about the AI-assisted routing proposals, please check out Intelligent Scenario to Find Similar Materials for Routing Proposal and Create a Routing using the AI-Assisted Material Search in the SAP Help Portal (content available as of 14 Jan, 2026).

So what’s SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) to do with it?

What Is ISLM: Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management is a standardized framework for building and managing AI use cases within SAP Cloud ERP for both embedded and side-by-side scenarios. It can be leveraged to perform lifecycle operations, including Scheduled Training and Retraining, and deployment of the model directly within SAP Cloud ERP.

The ISLM framework consists of two SAP Fiori applications, the Intelligent Scenarios app (App ID F4469) and the Intelligent Scenario Management app (App ID F4470). These two applications provide a unified interface for creating, deploying,  monitoring, and activating the model directly within SAP Cloud ERP.

The Intelligent Scenarios app is used to create, display, and configure various scenarios tailored to specific business needs. Using this app, you can view a list and activate SAP provided standard scenarios or create Embedded or Side-by-Side scenarios. 

For detailed information on ISLM, including its architecture of and how to set up an ISLM scenario, please refer to this blog post.

Now, let us use the SAP provided ISLM scenario "FIND_SIMBOMROUTINGV3" and take a look at the input and output fields used by the model. This predefined intelligent scenario allows you, as a user assigned with the business role Analytics Specialist (SAP_BR_ANALYTICS_SPECIALIST), to enable users to use the AI-assisted production routing proposal feature.

Note

Make sure to enable turnkey and review its schedule for the intelligent scenario to automate the prerequisites check, train, deployment, and run the activation. The calendar for the turnkey schedule is set to International, by default. For more information, see Turnkey (content available as of 14 Jan, 2026).

Fields
BOM and material-specific fields are provided in a flattened format to the model. The fields of the input material are compared with the fields provided to the model in order to find similar materials in the Manage Routing app. A maximum of 5000 characters in flattened format is allowed for each column that can be provided to the model. Output fields contain the results generated by the ML model after it is trained. These output fields provide the predictions and related metrics back to the business application. You can find a complete list of all fields here (content available as of 14 Jan, 2026).

Publication and Training

Once you have checked the fields, you can publish the scenario. After successfully publishing the ISLM scenario, you can move on to the Intelligent Scenario Management app to train the model and schedule it. The Intelligent Scenario Management app is used to manage, monitor,  and optimize AI driven scenarios throughout their entire lifecycle. 

Prerequisites Check

The recommended prerequisite check for the scenario "FIND_SIMBOMROUTINGV3" is 90 records, the minimum is 50 records.

Following the successful training, the system provides statistical information on variables and performance of the model. The model version report screen provides a summary about a particular model version. The quality information details varies according to the intelligent scenario type and underlying machine learning used.

For  a general introduction to  Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM), see Introduction to Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management(ISLM).

If you want to gain deeper understanding of SAP Signavio Process Manager & Process Collaboration Hub, dive into this blog post on SAP Signavio : The nuts and bolts of a well-thought-out SAP Signavio : Process Manager & Process Collaboration Hub.

Thanks for reading! Don’t hesitate to leave a comment and check out our community page to ask your questions and engage with the experts. Follow the PSCC_Enablement tag to stay up to date with our latest blog posts. 

Follow me on LinkedIn and stay up-to-date with our latest enablement assets: linkedin.com/in/annette-garcia-lorenzo
